Harold Hill
-2-
Febmary 19, I960
The other day Lee Campion, the educational television consultant for
DAVI, wrote me to find out about the utilization project* I had
mentioned this project in a letter to Dr* Anna Hyer and she had
told Lee of this work. It seems that the DAVI Television Committee
is interested in this problem of utilization also. Lee’s question
was whether or not we shouldn’t be working together. I wrote back
to Lee and said I would check with you about the possibilities of a
joint project. Lee suggested that we get together at their Cincinnati
convention to discuss the prospects* This would be find except I
am not planning on attending the Cincinnati meeting. It runs in my
mind that you have been working on a coordinated program with DAVI
so you will very likely be there. If you are, would it be possible
to meet with the Television Committee and find out what they have
on their mind? Off the record, I have mixed feelings about this
proposal* I can see an advantage to working with DAVI but I also
feel that we do not need them for successful completion of the
project. Of course, it wouldn’t hurt to talk with them and if it
is important enough1and you are not going to be at the convention
then I could use some of our money to go talk with them.
Unless time is important, this could very likely be taken care of
when I make my swing throughout the east. I had tentatively planned
on being in Washington anyway and would try and set up a meeting
with the DAVI people at that tine.
Right now I’m waiting for a reply from Lee as to what the Television
Committee has in mind and what they will be doing at the Cincinnati
convention. When I hear from them I will get in touch with you.
Director of School Programs
X and Research
